2025.query: PTC parametric technology competitors 2025 PLM CAD software
2025.context: PTC Inc. is a industrial software company focused on CAD, PLM, IoT, and augmented reality for manufacturing. Digital thread platform. Competing with Siemens, Dassault.

competitors.name: Siemens (Teamcenter + NX)
competitors.notes: Teamcenter is widely used comprehensive end-to-end PLM solution. Siemens NX is enterprise-grade CAD that scales well with strong PLM integration. The NX + Teamcenter combination offers deep native integration for complete CAD-PLM ecosystem.

competitors.name: Dassault Systèmes (ENOVIA + CATIA)
competitors.notes: ENOVIA offers 3D product architect tool for multi-CAD product structures using 3D Experience platform. CATIA is enterprise CAD for advanced assemblies and regulatory requirements. CATIA + ENOVIA provides deep native integration.

competitors.name: Autodesk (Fusion Manage + Fusion/Inventor)
competitors.notes: Autodesk Fusion Manage is cloud-based PLM with strong CAD integration, especially with Fusion 360 and AutoCAD. User-friendly interface well-suited for small to medium-sized businesses. Inventor offers 3D mechanical design, documentation, and simulation.

competitors.name: OpenBOM
competitors.notes: Modern, cloud-based platform for agile BOM management. Simplifies BOM creation, modification, and sharing across distributed teams. Features real-time collaboration, revision control, and automated part cataloging.

competitors.name: SolidWorks
competitors.notes: User-friendly CAD interface with strong community. Popular for small to medium-sized businesses, particularly in consumer products and industrial machinery sectors.

competitors.name: Onshape
competitors.notes: Cloud-native product development platform with integrated CAD, data management and analytics. Note: Onshape is owned by PTC but operates as a separate product line.

competitors.name: Solid Edge
competitors.notes: Siemens product development solution combining 3D design, simulation, manufacturing, data management, and cloud collaboration. Combines speed/simplicity of direct modeling with flexibility/control of parametric design.
